oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Individual transportation order #67101 for Angeline Taylor
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Armies -- Commissariat; Transportation, Military; United States -- Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands; Railroads; Jonesboro (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: U.S. Order for Transportation #67101 for Angeline Taylor, refugee, to travel from Knoxville to Jonesboro, Tennessee. Taylor was 10 years old and was going to live with her mother. The order includes a letter to W. A. Wainwright at the Freedmen's Bureau requesting that the order be issued.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Freedmen's Bureau, or the U. S. Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands, was created in 1865 and existed until 1872. It was organized to provide assistance to recently emancipated slaves and refugees (contraband) after the Civil War. The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay.
